channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024041604
item.description:
Report X-2024041604

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/30/2024 at approximately 0845, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment is a plastic jerrican that appears to have been damaged by equipment. Approximately 1 liter of liquid spilled from the container. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: ABF forklift operator was about to move a pallet of boxes on the dock at 335 and struck/punctured a box with the blade of his forklift. The box contained four 3.8 L jugs. Two of the jugs were pierced near the bottom and the entire contents of the 2 jugs spilled onto the dock.

item.title: Report X-2024050016
item.description:
Report X-2024050016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and torn. Upon inspection 4 bottles were discovered of which 2 had no visible damage and the other 2 had some internal leakage. Out of the 2 that leaked out 1 had only about a cup left of solution in the bottle, the other one had only spilled about 2 cups and had majority of the solution. Both bottles had loose caps causing the spillage. The package failure was due to the bottles having loose caps and seals causing internal leakage during the unloading phase. I recommend for better closures for the plastic bottles.

item.title: Report E-2024050000
item.description:
Report E-2024050000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1719 Pentrate Ultra Liquid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Kolor-Safe was then deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted pallet and absorbents were containerized into a second 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024050072
item.description:
Report X-2024050072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Large fully regulated hazmat containing 4 plastic one gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet on the bottom from one of the gallons having a large crack from the top to the bottom, spilling all of liquid inside. Stained other hazmat's as well and are not safe to transport. Hazmat was processed in the unload area and then was called out from the loading area as a damage. Hazmat seems to not have been handled carefully as it was being moved to be loaded. Also, shipper did not contain enough inner packaging to help hazmat as well.

  • Description: Driver reported the package was leaking. 1 bottle had a broken cap which caused all its contents to leak out. 1 bottle has a cracked/damaged lid, but nothing leaked out. All 4 bottles are compromised. THIS PACKAGE LEAKED ONTO AN LQ PKG (740714185640). INSIDE THE LQ PKG WAS A BOX OF FORKS AND A BOX OF WASP SPRAY. THE BOX OF FORKS WAS COMPROMISED BUT THE WASP SPRAY WAS FINE. SET THE WASP SPRAY ASIDE WITH A RELABEL ON IT PENDING DISPOSTION.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 plastic bottles was found with a loose cap. Bottle leaked out about 1/2 cup or less of solution from one of the part b bottles. Package failure was due to the bottle having a loose cap and movement during the unloading process caused the solution to leak out. Outer packaging was wet and ripped/ torn damaging tracking label. Op900 was intact. Package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.description:

  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg. was received off trailer 834045, damaged and wet. Pkg. taken to QA cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that the 5 gallon metal container had dents on the top and bottom, causing liquid to leak from the top closure. By looking at the container, it looks like the pkg. was mishandled when loading. Outside box did have orientation arrows on it, no protective material inside box.

item.title: Report E-2024050011
item.description:
Report E-2024050011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-27
  • City: LITTLE ROCK

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon metal drum containing SILQUEST TEOS PURE SILANE Tetraethoxysilane. The puncture came from a nail in a pallet and resulted in an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’x5’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and overpacked the damaged drum. One drum of waste was generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040680
item.description:
Report E-2024040680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2in-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal dock and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a damaged 55-gallon poly drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and used absorbent pads to gather the spent material. The recovered absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was emptied into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and the damaged 55-gallon was over-packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

The crew then overpacked the two (2) damaged drums in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh Bult Laundry Detergent 2 release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released from two pails due to damage caused by improper loading. The release impacted a 3’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Acid gator was then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and PPE were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged jug and deployed absorbents to the release. The crew worked them in with hand tools and further utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to further remediate the area. All UN1824 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum and two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • City: LEBANON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 237598
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The CMTV was travelling east on Central Pike. It drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CMTV skidded off the roadway through a fence and trees coming to a final rest in the field facing west. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil.

item.title: Report E-2024040117
item.description:
Report E-2024040117

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: IRON MOUNTAIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AUSTIN POWDER COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35025
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 6:55 am on 3/8/2024, Austin Powder drive was 4 miles south of Bismark MO at the intersect of N and NN. He was negotiating a lefthand turn driving a 2019 KW T880, loaded with AN emulsion, and diesel fuel for manufacturing bulk products. The drive swung too wide on a left hand turn and his passenger side went off the pavement. The driver slowed to an almost stop. The passenger side of the truck got stuck in the soft dirt and fell on its side. 20 pounds of AN spilled from one of the bins onto the ground. Roughly 50 gallons of offroad diesel spilled from the truck as well. The truck was put upright, and the AN spill was cleaned up and put into spill buckets and removed from the site. The diesel spill was contained using socks and booms. An environmental company came and removed the affected area at a later date.

  • Description: John Houle, 151 Operation Supervisor, advised Safety of a UN1133, Adhesives, 3, PG II spill on the trailer floor. John stated Curtis Baker was unloading the trailer when a box fell off the pallet causing the spill. Safety advised John that Cura will be called for remediation. Safety reviewed the pho tos showing the LTD QTY labels on the pallet behind the spill and called John back to confirm what spilled in the trailer before contacting CURA. John confirmed it was UN1133.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered damages at 11:30pm during the outbound sort. Smart portion of the contents leak on to the packaging and out the box onto the floor. After inspecting the type of hazmat we found that the liquid is Xylene a substance primarily used as a solvent. Local clean up was applied. The content container is glass when ultimately cracked and broke during Outbound 2 sort. The package was located in load 3 by safety specialist Brandon L. Burke.

  • City: KEASBEY

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During he day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and box torn. Upon inspection, 1 bottle was found inside the box in a plastic bag. Bottle was soiled due to leakage from the bottle and being trapped in the plastic bag. Bottle contained "BONDERITE C-IC 33 AERO" and leaked out about 1/3 of the liquid solution. Package failure seems to be caused by being dropped causing solution to leak out.

item.description:
Report X-2024041321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, USA CBP IMPORT OFFICIALS STOPPED A PACKAGE FROM TAIWAN FOR INSPECTION. THE INVOICE AND THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBE THE CONTENTS AS STORAGE BOTTLES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TEN INNER BOXES DESCRIBING CONTENTS AS KING GUARD SELF-DEFENSIVE BODY PROTECT AEROSOL TYPE AND CONTENTS UNDER PRESSURE. CONTENT INSPECTION OF THESE INNER BOXES REVEALS A TOTAL OF 100 AEROSOL CANS OF SELF DEFENSE KEYCHAIN-STYLE PEPPER SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged by a load shift and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the release. All spent absorbents were placed in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. All undamaged pails were overpacked in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040620
item.description:
Report E-2024040620

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel began remediation by patching the hole of the damaged drum and placing it into one (1) overpack. The dry adhesive was scraped off the floor, then absorbents were placed on the impacted area. All spent absorbents, and adhesive were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040619
item.description:
Report E-2024040619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of acetone were damaged due to a pallet failure in transit. Due to the damage, the drums released approximately ten (10) gallons of acetone to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected two (2) damaged drums and placed them in 85-gallon overpack for potential reuse. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent and absorbent pads to collect any residual product. All acetone impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of all three (3) drums to be added to the facility waste stream.

Some fuel went into a storm drain. Customer/shipper, Murphy USA was notified and assigned an emergency environmental response contractor to address remediate the area affected by the spill.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 12, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of chromium trioxide anhydrous were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. The two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails were over-packed into two separate 55-gallon drums. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents and neutralizer to the chromium trioxide anhydrous-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100036
item.description:
Report I-2024100036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: FAIRVIEW
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WASTE MANAGEMENT OF NEW JERSEY, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 5, 2023, a Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. truck inadvertently transported a container that contained several boxes with containers of plastic hand sanitizer bottles to the Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. Fairview Solid Waste Facility Transfer Station / Material Recovery Facility in Fairview, NJ. The origin location of the hand sanitizer is Pocas International, 19 Central Blvd, South Hackensack, NJ. The container was tipped onto the solid waste transfer station tip floor and upon discovery, the WMNJI Fairview Transfer Station personnel shut down the tipping floor to secure the area. The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection was notified and NJDEP incident ID# 23-12-05-1711-50 was assigned. The material was then re-packaged by a third party company (Whitman) into the appropriate containers, labeled, secured in a safe area at the facility for ultimate transportation to the appropriate facility for recycling or disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100035
item.description:
Report I-2024100035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: BYERS
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING GP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 168184
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 29, 2023 at approximately 9:57 AM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on NW 70th St near Byers in Pratt County, KS to Plains Wellsford Station east of Wellsford, KS. The driver ran off the roadway (right) onto the earthen shoulder, went to correct to enter back onto roadway (left) when trailer turned sideways and with momentum laid over onto its side. Upon landing on its side a seam on the trailer body was punctured, creating a small hole and as result 14 gallons of crude oil was released onto the roadway and into the roadside ditch. The transport vehicle was non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. The roadway was cleaned and impacted roadside ditch was excavated to remove impacted soil and area graded to restore contouring. The Plains driver was injured and treated at Hutchison Regional Medical Center in Hutchison, KS.

item.title: Report X-2024041291
item.description:
Report X-2024041291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON THE INNER 5 LITER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED FROM ONE OF THEM ONTO THE OUTER CARTON WHICH WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ONTO BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED TO SEE WHETHER THE CONTENTS WERE SALVAGEABLE FOR A REWRAP OR IF THEY HAD BEEN DAMAGED THE BAG OF ALGAECIDE WAS SEEN. IT HAD AN OXIDIZER DIAMOND AND THE UN NUMBER UN3378 PRINTED ONTO THE BAG ALONG WITH OTHER DANGER MARKINGS. INSIDE THE BOX WERE SMALL WHITE GRANULES THAT HAD COME OUT OF THE BAG. THEY DID NOT EVERY LEAK ANYWHERE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGING, BUT THE BAG IS DAMAGED.

item.title: Report X-2024041234
item.description:
Report X-2024041234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND PRODUCING A PUDDLE FROM SPILLAGE BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-C AT DOOR 27. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 2' PUDDLE OF LIQUID NEUTRALIZED CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A CRACK ON THE SIDE OF 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A CORRUGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOPX RATED AT A 350 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • City: CAROL STREAM

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fully regulated hazmat containing a plastic gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet and had strong fumes coming out from the gallon having a large crack on the body and spilling all of liquid. We mistakenly added foam neutralizer to try and contain the spill, but the chemicals reacted that caused box to get hot. Immediately showered it with water to contain it from getting worse and eventually cooled it down. Placed it inside a plastic drum as soon as it was good enough to touch, sealed it with double bag and zip ties. Did not want to open again to re examine for safety concerns.

item.title: Report X-2024041240
item.description:
Report X-2024041240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THERE WAS A FOUND PACKAGE WHERE THE CONTENTS APPEARED TO BE DAMAGED. THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A RESPONDER AND MADE HIS WAY BACK TO THE PRIMARY UNLOAD TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN TRAILER. DONNED PROPER PPE, FOLLOW THE DECISION TREE, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAILER TO OUR DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO CALL THE FT RMP FOR THE SORT, TO LET HIM KNOW ABOUT THE UNKOWN LEAKER. AFTER THE SORT, WHEN ENTERING THE PACKAGE INTO ETT AS A DAMAGE, WE OPENED IT TO FIND A DAMAGED/LEAKING BATTERY. UPON LOOKING UP THE SDS, IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN REGULATED AND SCBA DONNED. THIS IS WHEN FT RMP CALLED THE UPS HAZMAT HELP DESK, AND WE ENTERED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT INTO ETT. AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER HAD TO BE CALLED TO RESPOND TO THIS PACKAGE SINCE RESPONDER DID NOT HAVE PROPER PPE TO DMP THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report I-2024030012
item.description:
Report I-2024030012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T00:33:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: WARRIOR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LCT TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 76775
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: We transport UN 3170 Aluminum remelting by product in end dump trailers. Our driver was traveling north on 1-65 in Alabama. There had been snow and ice earlier that week. The driver came upon a multi vehicle accident. The driver attempted to slow and stop, but the vehicle got onto black ice and was unable to stop. This resulted in a collision that caused our trailer to partially over turn spilling some of the product. The divider wall prevented our trailer from completely turning over. Emergency response personal was notified, and clean up began. Alabama State Troopers have not produced an accident report as of 2/15/2024.

item.title: Report E-2024040610
item.description:
Report E-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote while at the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred into a new poly tote and then provided to the customer. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with all spent absorbent pads. The waste removed from site pending disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBO experienced a UN2810 XL-Dri release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to the metal drum lid only due to a loose bung cap. The cap was tightened and secured for shipment on. The released product was collected with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to the cardboard packaging and pallet only due to a pallet puncture. The impacted cardboard and pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum along with the spent absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Daniel Vallejos Operations Supervisor called to report a spill in trailer 84985 of a UN2880, CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE,HYDRATED, 5.1, PG II,. Daniel stated when the crew open the roll up door to unload the trailer. Daniel stated two pallets had fell over and started to come out the bottom of the roll up door while opening. Daniel stated 1 pail of the product the top lid came off and spilled what looked to be tablets on the trailer floor. Daniel stated he had already recouped the pallets and put the product (tablets) back in the pail and secured the lid to the pail. Safety advised Daniel any time th ere is a Hazmat spill safety is to be notified immediately before any cleanup is to start. Daniel stated that he would call safety next time before cleaning any spill. Daniel stated the spill was cleaned and the pallets were recouped and already unloaded off the trailer.

  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On April 16, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then overpacked the damaged pails in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

The waste was left in OS&D for the terminal to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/2/2024, at 1624 hours, FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector L. Rawls, at the CSXT Gentilly Yard in New Orleans, LA discovered UTLX 130322, a residue tank car last contained: Zinc Chloride, with the fill port cover open. The car was isolated and the shipper, Micronutrients, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-04-02--00252). Specialized Professional Services, Inc. (SPSI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to assess and correct the reported issue. SPSI personnel inspected, closed and secured the fill port cover. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Keith Hughes at 317-494-0256). While no visible product release was noted, because this shipment was found open to the atmosphere, and per FRA guidance, it is presumed that some volume of hazardous material vapor or residue was released.

  • Description: The hose connection was leaking when the driver started his unload. When they hook up they are to do a twist test on the hose to make sure it doesn't spin at all. Any movement indicates either the gasket is bad or the camlocks that lock it down may need to be shimmed. It did not twist when he tried moving it and the gaskets all looked good. After he applied shims though it did stop the leak. We're taking this hose out of use going forward and getting it back to the manufacturer so they can inspect it and replace the fitting on the end. 8 ounces hit the ground beyond the spill bucket.

item.title: Report I-2024040027
item.description:
Report I-2024040027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TEAM LOGISTICS COMPANY LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 140000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Team Logistics Driver Eric Bell (Owner Operator 1099 Contractor) was making a bulk delivery of gasoline to Race Trac #232 on 1450 McEver Road, Gainesville, GA 30501. The delivery's inception; TransMontaigne Terminal on 3450 Jefferson Road, Athens, GA 30607 loading of Metroplex Energy. In route to the delivery on Highway 53 @ Hoyt Holder Road heading North, in Braselton, GA. Mr. Bell failed to maintain his lane of travel and rolled his tractor trailer. Mr. Bell stated, there were three vehicles in front of him traveling approximately 25 mph, and another vehicle turning right (South) from Hoyt Holder Road causing him to move toward the right shoulder. This movement brought Mr. Bells tires off the road and onto the soft, muddy shoulder. As Mr. Bell brought his tractor back onto the roadway the trailer entered a drop off area that turned the unit over. The tractor trailer rolled completely over with the tractor blocking both sides of Hwy 53, and the trailer positioned upside down arched between the road and the drop off area, slanting down about eight feet. Fortunately, Mr. Bell was able to evacuate the vehicle sustaining no injuries. Once out of the unit, Mr. Bell secured the scene making sure there were no hazardous materials compromising the environment. Jackson County Sheriff's Office and Fire Department were dispatched to the scene of the accident. GA DOT also was present to close Highway 53 off and to verify the hazardous cargo was not compromising the environment. GA DOT officer MCO Fortson conducted a DOT inspection on the vehicle following the FMCSA-inspection Platform (Driver/Vehicle Examination Report). Seymour's Towing and Recovery responded to the emergency for remediation and recovery. Team Logistics Emergency Team brought another tanker truck to transfer products. After conducting a safety briefing, a plan was put into place. The Jackson County Fire Department evacuated the three residents near the accident location for two hours during the transfer of product for safety, then set up a foam and water deployment location. Seymour's grounded and bonded the tanker for transfer, then secured the rolled unit with two wreckers.

item.title: Report I-2024040028
item.description:
Report I-2024040028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 17:45hrs 3/12/2024, Southeastern Freight Lines employee attempted to load the Outbound shipment onto trailer 289184F located in dock door 35. While loading a protruding piece of wood punctured the 250 gallon tote of UN2922 product. This caused approximately 50 gallons of the product to spill in the Southeastern trailer & on the dock. The tote was maneuvered on its side immediately in efforts to stop the spillage. Containment boom, absorbent pad, & floor dry were used in additional efforts to contain the spill. None of the chemical was near or entered any type of drain system. Southeastern Freight Lines Safety was notified approximately at 17:50hrs. Hazmat 1 was notified approximately at 18:01 hrs. LA State Police & E3/OMI Environmental arrived approximately between 19:30 -20:00hrs. After accessing the situation at hand, E3/OMI Environmental proceeded to pump the waste chemical from the damaged tote into a new tote. They also cleaned & decontaminated the affected area. All clean up efforts concluded approximately at 02:00hrs. E3/OMI will coordinate the pick up of the following: 1-empty 250 gallon tote, 1-300 gallon tote, 4-55 gallon drums with clean up, 1-bag of contaminated pallets & packaging materials, & 1 bag w/ contaminated wooden crate.

item.title: Report I-2024020083
item.description:
Report I-2024020083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: CORDOVA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 2/6/2024 a SOO Line Railroad (DBA CPKC) Hazardous Materials Officer, Anthony Houdyshell, became aware that FRA Inspector Daniel Perkins had performed a hazmat inspection at the CPKC CORDOVA SPUR TRACK, in CORDOVA, IL. During the Inspection Mr. Perkins cited ECUX 461228 because it was leaking OCTYL ALCOHOL from the bottom outlet valve (BOV) threads past the BOV cap. Estimated release was less than 0.5 gallon. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate and mitigate the leak. Upon arrival, responders found ECUX 46 1228 with a BOV not secured tool tight, and the presence of product weeping around the threads of the BOV cap. The BOV was in the fully closed position, but responders observed that the four-inch bottom outlet ball valve had a small amount of product on the 8-L side of the ball. 1-2 drops fell every 2-3 minutes. Additionally, the four inch bottom outlet flange gasket was observed to be out of round and slightly warped, although the release was not related to the warped gasket. The BOV cap was tightened tool tight with PTFE tape to stop the weeping. The response contractor placed an out of service tag on the BOV, and applied HOMESHOP stickers to both sides of the tank car. The contractor climbed ECUX 461228 and observed the manway with a single loose manway swing bolt. The manway cover seal was cut, all swing bolts loosened, and the manway opened. The manway gasket was verified in good condition. The manway was then closed, and the manway swing bolts were secured to tool tight. Responders returned to Cordova, IL on the following day and verified that ECUX 461228 was not leaking prior to the car being switched into the 3M facility. This move (400 ft) was made under the emergency provisions of 174.5, with a verbal notification made by Houdyshell to FRA. The car was subsequently unloaded by 3M and then an OTMA was obtained to move the car to home shop by ExxonMobil. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a "bulk" shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
